author: Ramack
title: Heritage hotel with old fashioned hospitality
text:
This review is based on two stays - in August and again in December 2016. The Coopmanhuijs hotel is in a beautiful heritage building which dates back to the 18th century. Because of this, the bedrooms are very small by 5 star standards (it may, in fact, be a bit misleading to call this a 5-star hotel). However, the imported bathroom tiles and fittings, the individually decorated rooms, the fine fabrics, handmade furnishings and the wonderful artwork and objets d'art displayed throughout the property make this a rare treat.
The hotel is perfectly located on a vibrant, main street in Stellenbosch making it perfect for shopping, restaurants and generally enjoying the vibe of this charming little town. The hotel offers valet parking so all you need do is pull up to the red awning and the staff do the rest.
The rooms, although small, are comfortable and the beds come equipped with a wondeful down-like mattress topper which one just sinks into. Pure heaven! There are tea/coffee making facilities in the room. Be warned that the rooms at the top of the stairs, although offering the best views over the street, are just above the restaurant and the smells and sounds do carry.
Breakfast is included in the rate and consists of an ample buffet (cereals, beautiful breads, meats and fruit) and a delicious cooked to order option. The eggs benedict was delicious. True to its heritage, this property offers old fashioned hospitality - we found the service throughout extremely friendly and attentive. Once you look past the Lilliputian rooms, what makes this hotel perfect for us is its location, its gracious elegance and the level of hospitality. We look forward to our next visit.
